event:
Life is magical and full of joy.

Two more victories for my New York teams today.  The Giants totally dominated Tampa Bay, holding them to under a hundred yards of total offense, shutting down their run game completely, pitching a 24-0 shutout.  On offense, Jacobs and Bradshaw both ran the ball convincingly, Eli and the receivers looked sharp.  The Scottish Kicker did miss a chip shot field goal, probably because the commentators jinxed him by mentioning his name.  That, and a few new injuries, were the only flies on what was otherwise a complete victory.  I am especially worried about Kareem McKenzie, who was carried off on a cart.  The G-Men have looked very strong to date, but the injuries have really started to pile up, and that is worrisome.

The Jet game was much more exciting.  Dressed in their throwback New York Titans unis, the Jets jumped off to a fast 14-0 start and for a bit the game looked like a blowout.  But a fumble changed the momentum and the Titans (in their throwback Oiler unis) came roaring back in the second and third quarters to go ahead 17-14.  Then came another turnover, and Big Mo shifted back.  The last quarter belonged to the Jets.  Sanchez had some trouble with the wet ball, but played pretty well, all in all.  Jericho was a beast, especially on that long catch.  The Jets special teams were outstanding.  And the defense... what was especially impressive was how much Rex changed his game plan from last week.  Gone were all the blitzes.  Instead the Jets focused on shutting down the Tennessee running game, their strength, and were successful.  

The weirdest thing was that the two games were being played simultaneously, which I don't recall ever seeing before, in all my years of watching football.  I had to switch back and forth between them on my TiVo, and inevitably some plays got spoiled for me.

Next week the Giants go to Kansas City for their third road game in a row, and the Jets face their sternest test yet when they go to New Orleans to play Drew Brees and the high-flying Saints.

comments.article: Start preparing yourself for disappointment next week! WHO DAT!
comments.subject: Sorry but...

comments.article: Geaux Saints!
comments.subject: Re: Sorry but...

comments.article: The Giants are going to eat the Chiefs raw.
No, no, no.  Life is miserable and full of pain.  The Falcons lost to the Patriots.  I knew I should have flown to Mass and gone Tonya Harding on Tom Brady.
Though as a UGA alum, I am glad that Stafford and Detroit got their first win.

Life is magical...if you are also a Ravens fan like me!

(Oh, is that allowed - mentioning the hated Ravens on a site owned by a Giants fan, I mean?)
Hear Hear!

Mr. M,

Gotta hand it to you for taking it to the devil like that. You sell him your already-of-pretty-dubious-value soul for the Tyree catch and then you sell it to him AGAIN to get both NY area teams 3-0?

I'd put the Giants at 1 and the Jets at 1A were it not for those Ravens. I'd ask you to wish me luck next week, but . . .

ELB
comments.subject: How Many Times?

comments.article: Poor pitiable Chiefs.  How would you like the Giants' victory served next week?  'Cause as my husband says, they aren't the Chiefs at the moment--they're the Chefs, and they are going to be serving up some ugly football.  Bon appétit.

Next week is but another opportunity for Sanchez to prove himself!

Which of course he shall.
It's a good thing your Jets have Sanchez, because Thomas the Tank Engine sure isn't getting it done for them.  (Or for me on my fantasy team.)
I have him on one of my fantasy teams, too.  I wish he'd get more carries. He did great in week 1.
I rarely root against you but Go Saints!!!  Also Go Giants!!!

When we had reached the third quarter and still not yet managed a first down, I told my sister, "I predict Martin's life will soon be magical and full of joy. So magical he will in fact be pooping actual unicorns."

Let me know if you spot any.

I have a feeling that as soon as the Lion finished 0-16 last year, the Bucs started whistling "Anything you can do I can do better..."

If they're going to play this badly, they could at least do the decent thing and bring back the creamsicle suits.
comments.subject: A fellow Bucs fan here
Re: A fellow Bucs fan here

comments.article: Not to get too off-track, but who'd of thought that the Lions would beat the Skins?!
Jets are goin' DOWN!!  Who Dat!
Hey look at that, the Giants are like the opposite of the Skins this year.

It was an odd day for NY sports--the Jets and the Yankees (and their opponents, and the NFL/MLB commissioners) agreed to move their games to 1:00pm EST so that they would be finished before the start of Yom Kippur. It was the first time in several decades that the Giants and Jets played concurrently when not playing each other. With the Yankees set to clinch the AL East vs the hated Red Sox, our remote control got quite a work out yesterday. Life is indeed magical and full of joy.
comments.subject: Yom Kippur

comments.article:
This is no doubt the best Jets team I have seen in a long time. VERY physical. They certianly remind me of Rex's Ravens, which is troubling to a NE fan like myself.

The pats won. Im not sure if its because they are getting better or if the falcons are just that bad. This is going to be a strange season I think, not just in NE but all over the country. Alot of upsets and strangely scored games these first three weeks.

Id rather our momentum be at the end of the season rather than the begining though, I think thats obvious.

The way the giants are playing, wow! Id really like to see a pats giants rematch...I just hope the pats are ready for such an encounter.
Oh yes, sooooo magical. No time for subtlety, some of us work for a living.

Sanchez isnt used to the Northern climates, having played in sunny CA all the time. Rain? Whats that. Wait until he has to deal with snow.

I heard that the reason the Giants and Jets played at the same time was because Yom Kipour started last night at sundown, so lots of TV sets in the NY area would have to be snapped off.

Crucify him.

WHO DAT!
comments.subject: Let Mark Sanchez contemplate this on the tree of woe..

comments.article:
Heh....Tree of Woe. Nice.

And Who Dat!
comments.subject: Re: Let Mark Sanchez contemplate this on the tree of woe..
Re: Let Mark Sanchez contemplate this on the tree of woe..

comments.article: The games were both at one so that Jews like yours truly could both watch the games and then attend Yom kippur services in the evening.  NY has a huge Jewish population.
Niners lose a heart breaker.  Still can't believe how that one turned out. Oh well, thank the football Gods for the Rams.
comments.subject: Life is meaningless and full of pain

comments.article:
The injuries especially to the secondary is very concerning. Johnson got exposed a bit in the 4th quarter. Hopefully he'll feel more comfortable and be better prepared next week. The O-line should be fine (crossed fingers). The team definitely doesn't need any more injuries.

Jets look great. That Sanchez. If ever a kid could wear the nickname 'Franchise' in this town, it's him. Looks like he'll be working on better ball protection this week. Now, if the Jets can get an 'A' receiver. Ryan's showing just how good a head coach he is. Not only in preparation, but game calling as well. Wow!

At sunset Sunday, through today is the high holy day of Yom Kippur. That is why all NYC teams played early. Many of the fans needed to be able to get home or turn off the TV by sunset.

STAY HUNGRY, STAY HUMBLE.
Well, the Lions won their first game since December 23, 2007.  That's pretty damn magical too.  1-2 is a pretty damn good start for Detroit, compared to the last few years...
The Jets game was originally scheduled for 4pm ET.  But the NFL moved it up to 1pm by request because Yom Kippur began at sunset on Sunday.
Glad for the Jets' success.  But they come to our house next week.  This should be a great game!
comments.subject: Welcome to Thunderdome

comments.article:
Curoius, do you happen to know if David "The Catch" Tyree has been picked up yet?

Two stellar starts for your NY-teams. Rex Ryan seems to have an everyman appeal quality that makes the team fun & likeable, of course winning doesn't hurt either huh?
